question:
Which of the following statements are
true about acceleration due to gravity?
This question has multiple correct options
option_1: \( g \) decreases in moving away from the centre if \( r>R \)
option_2: \( g \) decreases in moving away from the centre if \( r<R \)
option_3: \( g \) is zero at the centre of the earth
option_4: \( g \) decreases if earth stops rotating on its axis
Subject: Physics
correct_answer: \( g \) decreases in moving away from the centre if \( r>R \)

correct_answer: Has the same value everywhere in space

question:
A particle of mass \( m \) moving with a velocity \( (3 \hat{i}+2 \hat{j}) m s^{-1} \) collides with

\( (-2 \hat{i}+\hat{j}) m s^{-1} . \) Then during the
collision:

This question has multiple correct options

option_2: Impulse received by \( m \) is \( m(-5 \hat{i}-\hat{j}) \)
option_4: Impulse received by \( M \) is \( m(5 \hat{i}+\hat{j}) \)

correct_answer: Impulse received by \( m \) is \( m(5 \hat{i}+\hat{j}) \)
